abstract: Stocks swung wildly on Tuesday as the government’s $700 billion bailout plan for the financial system met with some resistance on Capitol Hill.
snippet: Stocks swung wildly on Tuesday as the government’s $700 billion bailout plan for the financial system met with some resistance on Capitol Hill.
lead_paragraph: For most of Tuesday, stocks ambled from modest rise to modest fall, avoiding the triple-point swings that have become the trademark of a market adrift in uncertainty and fear. With half an hour to go in the session, it looked as if Wall Street might enjoy a relatively quiet day, despite the political fisticuffs on Capitol Hill.

headline.main: Skeptics in Washington, Sellers on Wall Street
headline.print_headline: A Day of Mild Swings Takes a Late Dive as Anxiety Returns
